edu.ncsu.csc216.wolf_library.patron

Class PatronTest

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.ncsu.csc216.wolf_library.patron.PatronTest

  • public class PatronTest
extends java.lang.Object
    The patron test checks several patron names to ensure the patrons can only be created if they are in a valid format per the specifications. For that reason the tests also throw several exceptions.
    Author:
    Marcus

    • Method Detail

      • setUp

        public void setUp()
           throws java.lang.Exception
        The set up method creates several books and patrons for testing.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • testPatron

        public void testPatron()
        Test method for Patron.Patron(java.lang.String, java.lang.String, int) . The test method tests patron constructor. It primarily ensures the class throws the proper exceptions.

      • testTraverseReserveQueue

        public void testTraverseReserveQueue()
        Test method for Patron.traverseReserveQueue() . The test reserve queue tests whether we can traverse the reserve queue. The first test checks to ensure the method works with an empty String. The second ensures it works a book added.

      • testTraverseCheckedOut

        public void testTraverseCheckedOut()
        Test method for Patron.traverseCheckedOut(). The test traverse checked out method tests whether we can traverse the checked out queue. The first test checks to ensure the method works with an empty queue. The second checks if it works after having added a book.

      • testMoveAheadOneInReserves

        public void testMoveAheadOneInReserves()
        Test method for Patron.moveAheadOneInReserves(int) . The test move ahead one method ensures the reserve queue will swap pairs of books to move one ahead. It also ensures the boundaries throw the appropriate exceptions.

      • testUnReserve

        public void testUnReserve()
        Test method for Patron.unReserve(int). The test unreserve method ensures the book at the appropriate position gets removed. It also ensures the appropriate exceptions are thrown from using bad positions.

      • testReserve

        public void testReserve()
        Test method for Patron.reserve(edu.ncsu.csc216.wolf_library.inventory.Book) . The test reserve method ensures a book is added to the reserve queue appropriately. It also checks the exception for a null book.

      • testCloseAccount

        public void testCloseAccount()
        Test method for Patron.closeAccount(). The close account method ensures all the books have been returned. Other methods remove it from the patron database. The important thing is to ensure the books do not get lost with the account.

      • testReturnBook

        public void testReturnBook()
        Test method for Patron.returnBook(int). The return book method ensures the book disappears from the patron's checked out queue once returned. It also tests the exceptions using bad indexes to ensure the exceptions get caught.

      • testHashCode

        public void testHashCode()
        Test method for User.hashCode(). The method tests the hash code. The hash code should be the same for different patrons with identical data members.

      • testUser

        public void testUser()
        Test method for User.User(java.lang.String, java.lang.String) . The test user method tests the creation of the user parent class. Since it throws several exceptions, it's important to cover as many of them as possible.

      • testVerifyPassword

        public void testVerifyPassword()
        Test method for User.verifyPassword(java.lang.String) . The verify password method checks the password twice. The first uses the actual password, which should return true. The second test uses the wrong password to ensure the method returns false.

      • testGetId

        public void testGetId()
        Test method for User.getId(). The test get id ensures the user's id actually gets returned.

      • testCompareTo

        public void testCompareTo()
        Test method for User.compareTo(edu.ncsu.csc216.wolf_library.patron.User) . The compare to method ensures the patron's lexicographical comparisons work correctly. The method should return not equals if patron alpha compares to patron beta. Patrons with the same name should return 0.
